abstract.original_text: Surveillance is the ongoing systematic collection, analysis, and interpretation of data essential to public health practice for public health action. This article describes important principles, techniques, and global trends in modern infectious disease surveillance. The article highlights the integration of laboratory and epidemiological methods, together with information technology.
